title: Encouraging Progress and Planning for Impact

messages.content:
Can you summarize this into two paragraphs as a post in a community forum? 0:00

Hello and good morning to the Eon teams. I'm really excited about the progress we've made so far and I wanted to first of all encourage everybody to go over the dashboard.

0:15

So this is the template. This is how you're going to rock the program. This is how, you're going to be able to know how everything fits together from your assessments all the way to your budget for your project and it's actually quite important.

0:30

So Richard has a video about how to do the budget planning over here and you'll be able to see how your budget breaks down into, the objectives that you have over here and the objectives are actually connected to your assessments and so we want to be sure that everybody has taken the assessment because

0:51

the assessment will help you pick the right thing to work on as an objective and the right thing to fund in the budget.

0:59

So it's all connected. So the way you can, take your assessment, you can see this is my results. I took the ACAP because I'm running an accelerator not an enterprise and you can see over here, take assessment and for you, you'll see fewer of them.

1:11

You'll just see the enterprise capacity, V1, and you can click take assessment. You'll see your results. I want to encourage people.

1:18

Don't just pick the one with the smallest number. Essentially, you'll want to do more work on something that you already are making good progress with.

1:26

And if you've taken notes, you'll be able to see that in the details section. And you can see where you have comments and potentially that might give you a better insight about where to work.

1:37

So who did the assessments? Let's celebrate. Keenan. Esmin, Jana, Michel, the world sucks, tenus, me, tari, dmariam, a Esmin, Jana, Michel, the world sucks, tenus, me, tari, dmariam, i'm work on your dashboard, so essentially take the assessment and then pick over here which one from the assessment

2:09

, which category would make the most amount of sense for you and then go to the second tab of the program dashboard, this is the template reminder and work on.

2:22

And you're budget because we're going to be working on this tomorrow. And I also want to give some shout outs to Richard for making the contents in the community home for the program.

2:34

This is session three. It already has over here. If you want to know how to make the budget video, click over here and you'll see a great video from.

2:43

Richard about how to develop your budget and how it's all connected. If you need some instructions and then otherwise you can go back to the program to see sprint session two the videos that we've created.

2:56

And also it's been great because we've been sharing and learning and growing together here. And the, oh, nice. So they have already uploaded their dashboard for Lebanese spotlight.

3:09

Yeah, I'm coming over here. I'm responding to everybody. Feel free to add your questions and your connections here in the Eon program on the community platform along with your your budget plan.

3:23

After you make the template, please share it. In sprint session three, this will be a good place to upload it.

3:29

If you want to know how to do that, you create a new topic. And then you say rooms program, budget budget, and then you can actually just put in links over here.

3:43

And that would be great. You can add some questions, we can tag each other. And that's all. So I hope you guys are having a beautiful day.

3:51

I just wanted to walk you over the importance of why we're taking these assessments, how these assessments break down into your program dashboard all the way to the budget so we can see what.

4:03

The right thing to spend money on is, you know, we have not many opportunities to do things well and do things right.

4:12

So let's take some time to take the assessment to reflect. And then to design our objectives here in the organization development plan, and then to see how best to spend.

4:23

The potential funding to take our project forward and make it more established. Okay. I hope you're having a beautiful day.

4:31

And I will see you guys tomorrow for day three of the sprint. So that and I'll put this in the community page as well.

messages.content:
Here is a summary in two paragraphs:

I wanted to encourage everyone to review the program dashboard and take the assessment. The assessments connect to your objectives and budgets, so it's important to understand your capacity and priorities. Some of you have already shared your dashboards, which is great. Please keep posting your questions, insights, and materials to the community platform.  

We have made a lot of progress so far, but we have limited opportunities to do things right. Take time to reflect on your assessment results and design thoughtful objectives. Then determine how to best allocate funding to establish your project. I hope you're having a good day. See you tomorrow for the next sprint session. Keep up the great work!

content.text:
Here is a summary in two paragraphs:

I wanted to encourage everyone to review the program dashboard and take the assessment. The assessments connect to your objectives and budgets, so it's important to understand your capacity and priorities. Some of you have already shared your dashboards, which is great. Please keep posting your questions, insights, and materials to the community platform.  

We have made a lot of progress so far, but we have limited opportunities to do things right. Take time to reflect on your assessment results and design thoughtful objectives. Then determine how to best allocate funding to establish your project. I hope you're having a good day. See you tomorrow for the next sprint session. Keep up the great work!

messages.content: how would you say this differently and less corny? **Leading the way:**

content.text: how would you say this differently and less corny? **Leading the way:**

messages.content:
Here is a revised summary in two paragraphs:

Team, I wanted to check in on our progress for the program dashboard and assessments. Completing the assessments is key to gaining insight into our priorities and capacity, which then informs the objectives and budgets. Some teams have shared their draft dashboards, which is a great start. Please continue posting questions or comments in the community and sharing your work.  

We've made progress, but we need to be strategic with limited resources. Carefully review your assessment results to determine focused objectives and budgets. Our time and funding are scarce, so we must be targeted and impactful. I know we're up for the challenge. Keep pushing ahead and reach out if you have any blockers. The program team is here to support you. Looking forward to reviewing the updated dashboards and budgets tomorrow in our next working session. Onward!

content.text:
Here is a revised summary in two paragraphs:

Team, I wanted to check in on our progress for the program dashboard and assessments. Completing the assessments is key to gaining insight into our priorities and capacity, which then informs the objectives and budgets. Some teams have shared their draft dashboards, which is a great start. Please continue posting questions or comments in the community and sharing your work.  

We've made progress, but we need to be strategic with limited resources. Carefully review your assessment results to determine focused objectives and budgets. Our time and funding are scarce, so we must be targeted and impactful. I know we're up for the challenge. Keep pushing ahead and reach out if you have any blockers. The program team is here to support you. Looking forward to reviewing the updated dashboards and budgets tomorrow in our next working session. Onward!
